data.text: @ECDC_EU @EUCouncil @EU_Commission @SKyriakidesEU @EU_Health @WHO @WHO_Europe @Eurosurveillanc @EUCouncilPress @EFSA_EU @EU_opendata You should criticize countries that doesn’t provide sufficient testing/data. We must learn what results different strategies gives for future waves/pandemics.

@ECDC_EU @EUCouncil @EU_Commission @SKyriakidesEU @EU_Health @WHO @WHO_Europe @Eurosurveillanc @EUCouncilPress @EFSA_EU @EU_opendata How are other member states going to be able to assess the situation in Sweden in order to protect themselves? Doesn’t this go against EU law?

@Folkhalsomynd

@ECDC_EU @EUCouncil @EU_Commission @SKyriakidesEU @EU_Health @WHO @WHO_Europe @Eurosurveillanc @EUCouncilPress @EFSA_EU @EU_opendata What's the difference between "Testing rate < 600" and  "Insufficient data"? 😳

@Cekbe8 @ECDC_EU @EUCouncil @EU_Commission @SKyriakidesEU @EU_Health @WHO @WHO_Europe @Eurosurveillanc @EUCouncilPress @EFSA_EU @EU_opendata @Folkhalsomynd Not necessarily. The with and of covid deaths have diverged dramatically since Omicron.

ICU and stuff like wastewater measurements better. https://t.co/9NADP94U8S https://t.co/fIu6cHYEn6

@ECDC_EU @EUCouncil @EU_Commission @SKyriakidesEU @EU_Health @WHO @WHO_Europe @Eurosurveillanc @EUCouncilPress @EFSA_EU @EU_opendata In consequence to restricted testing of SARS-CoV-2, the most reliable data mirroring contagion rate available are the official statistics from the Public Health Agency on deceased people diagnosed with CoViD-19. https://t.co/BtezrnDJfC

Color-blind friendly version of the map:
https://t.co/CcBVx6B0o5
#COVID19 https://t.co/KFljryFU8s
